1_1NAaF8VitwKSPo79RzJFhqz14gndmdWcGV.body: > [testingzeronet12](#comment_131_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Did you implement optional files? if so, how did you do so? You can look at the content.json - I added the below line to content.json and then signed and published, what automatically generated a long list of all the (optional) files from the folders: "optional" : "(folder/subfolder/.*)",

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_134_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): Thanks. On which line number should I add that piece of code?

I don't think the line number does really matter, but have a look at the content.json file in the site above and scroll down to the very bottom, you will see this line there.

> [testingzeronet12](#comment_135_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN): The lines with optional that I see are:
>  "files_optional": {  "SIDtoday/data/0001.pdf": {   "sha512": "bbc311bb92e0b5dc474036edc0eeee9ebeb3821e0741cf181252a808a83d5942",   "size": 29937
> and
> "optional": "(EquationGroup/data/.|SnowdenLeaks/.|SIDtoday/.*)",

The "optional" it is. The long "files_optional" list automatically gets generated when signing a content.json with the "optional" line. "Files_optional" lists all items from the folders specified under "optional".

2_1KzaKud9cUZB7HcgHnhrZqyuq2NnTeW6PR.body: For safety reasons I would install it on a virtual machine, especially when using Windows. If a site hosts malicious software, it'd be downloaded to your machine. Just get virtual box (it is free), install Windows (with activation hack) or Ubuntu on it and you're good to go.

> [zarty](#comment_5_1KzaKud9cUZB7HcgHnhrZqyuq2NnTeW6PR): Interesting.  Can you tell me where to find free virtual boxes?  Sounds good to me!

There's a bit of a learning curve involved but it is doable with the right tutorials (That's how I learnt it).
With virtualbox you can create a computer inside of your computer and install an OS in it. Now I could write a book but there's a lot of information out there on Google.

Looks like you have MacOS. You should have at least 2 GB RAM free for your virtual machine and a nice CPU as your hardware will be shared by two computers.

1. First of all, you will need to download the virtualbox software on your computer. Get virtualbox from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads

2. Get an ISO file for the OS you want to install - for Linux (for absolute beginners Mint Cinnamon would be a good choice as the UI is similar to Windows, simply head to https://www.linuxmint.com/edition.php?id=217). 
If you want to install Windows, you can get an iso (at best Win7 64bit) from a torrent website, e.g. pirate bay or maybe you have a physical disk at home. For Windows you would neen an activation crack as well of course. 

3. To create a virtual machine with virtualbox and the iso, you will find thousands of guides online, e.g. http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/how-to-use-virtualbox/ or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PL7Dh6drlBw

4. You will have a computer inside a computer, on which you can install ZeroNet.

> [zarty](#comment_6_1KzaKud9cUZB7HcgHnhrZqyuq2NnTeW6PR): Thank you. Much appreciated.

You are welcome :) If you install Ubuntu/Linux Mint on the VM, setting up Tor is not too hard:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/faq/
